attributes.action: Remove the self isolation clause in Visit Out of Care Home Guidance.
attributes.additional_details: My brother has cerebral palsy, is wheelchair bound and communicates through a device. He has had both vaccines and desperately wants to come home for a visit. He is crying repeatedly because the requirement to self isolate has made any visits out untenable due the impact it would have on his mental health. This is against his human rights, is unlawful and discriminatory.
attributes.background: Urgently review the Visit Out guidance for Care Homes to enable residents to visit family and friends without the need to self isolate for 14 days afterwards. Use PCR / LFT testing as with staff instead.

rejection.details:
There’s already a petition about this issue. We cannot accept a new petition when we already have one about a very similar issue.

You are more likely to get action on this issue if you sign and share a single petition.

You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583440

We have marked your petition as private because it contains personal information about your brother.
